content.question: Which of the following describes the effect of skin color, ethnicity, and former slave status in Latin America in the late nineteenth century?

choices.label: There was little effect for most people.
People of African descent were not affected, but Latin American Indians continued to suffer discrimination.
Marriage alliances among all classes and castes eliminated the effect of all three.
Large numbers of people of color migrated to the newly “Reconstructed” southern United States.
There continued to be discrimination on the basis of all three factors.

content.answer: There continued to be discrimination on the basis of all three factors.
